articles.author: SARAH EL DEEB
articles.description: BEIRUT (AP) — He is among the very last survivors of his Gaza family, a clan so close they knew without thinking how blood and marriage bound them across generations and city blocks.Then, branch by branch, 173 of Youssef Salem’s relatives were killed in Israeli airstrikes in a matter of days in December.
articles.title: The war in Gaza has wiped out entire Palestinian families. AP documents 60 who lost dozens or more

articles.author: TIA GOLDENBERG
articles.description: TEL AVIV, Israel (AP) — Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu dissolved the influential War Cabinet tasked with steering the war in Gaza, Israeli officials said Monday, a move that comes days after a key member of the body bolted the government over frustrations surrounding the Israeli leader's handling of the war.
articles.title: Israeli officials say Netanyahu has dissolved the War Cabinet after key partner bolted government

articles.author: WILL WEISSERT
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Joe Biden’s reelection campaign is spending $50 million through the end of June, a blitz that includes its first television ad trumpeting Donald Trump’s felony conviction and signals that the Democratic incumbent is seeking to make his Republican opponent’s legal woes a bigger issue heading into November.
articles.title: Biden's campaign announces a $50 million advertising blitz highlighting Trump's conviction

articles.author: MICHELLE CHAPMAN
articles.description: The U.S. surgeon general has called on Congress to require warning labels on social media platforms similar to those now mandatory on cigarette boxes.
articles.title: Surgeon general calls on Congress to require social media warning labels, like those on cigarettes

articles.author: BRIAN WITTE
articles.description: ANNAPOLIS, Md. (AP) — Maryland Gov. Wes Moore is scheduled to sign an executive order to issue more than 175,000 pardons for marijuana convictions Monday, the governor's office said.
articles.title: Maryland Gov. Wes Moore set to issue more than 175,000 pardons for marijuana convictions

articles.author: NINIEK KARMINI
articles.description: JAKARTA, Indonesia (AP) — Muslims in Asia on Monday celebrated Eid al-Adha, or the Feast of Sacrifice, with food and prayers for people in Gaza suffering from the Israel-Hamas war.
articles.title: Muslims in Asia celebrate Eid al-Adha with sacrifice festival and traditional feast

articles.description: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — Russian President Vladimir Putin will visit North Korea for a two-day visit starting Tuesday, both countries announced, amid international concerns about their military cooperation.
articles.title: Putin to visit North Korea for talks with Kim Jong Un, both countries say

articles.author: JON GAMBRELL
articles.description: ABOARD THE USS DWIGHT D. EISENHOWER IN THE RED SEA (AP) — The USS Dwight D. Eisenhower may be one of the oldest aircraft carriers in the U.S. Navy, but it's still fighting — despite repeated false claims by Yemen's Houthi rebels.
articles.title: US aircraft carrier counters false Houthi claims with 'Taco Tuesdays' as deployment stretches on

articles.author: ANITA SNOW
articles.description: PHOENIX (AP) — Hot and cold extremes are expected this week in the U.S. Officials warned Southwest residents to take precautions as a heat wave moves east, while heavy rains and flooding could drench the Gulf states and snow threatens parts of the Rockies and Northwest.
articles.title: Severe weather forecast around US with high Southwest temperatures, Gulf rain and Rockies snow

articles.author: PATRICK WHITTLE and HOLLY RAMER
articles.description: PORTLAND, Maine (AP) — The deadly implosion of an experimental submersible en route to the deep-sea grave of the Titanic last June has not dulled the desire for further ocean exploration, despite lingering questions about the disaster.
articles.title: A year after the Titan's tragic dive, deep-sea explorers vow to pursue ocean's mysteries
